intro: Clusia criuva subsp. vera, commonly known as the yellow glorybower, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean and northern South America. It is a shrub or small tree that typically grows in coastal and lowland areas. The plant is characterized by its glossy, dark green leaves and clusters of yellow flowers that bloom throughout the year. It has a woody stem and produces small, fleshy fruits that contain seeds. Clusia criuva subsp. vera is often used in landscaping due to its ornamental value and ability to thrive in various soil conditions.
